results.byline: By Robert Draper, Luke Broadwater and Philip Montgomery
results.title: Inside the Jan. 6 Committee
results.abstract: Power struggles, resignations and made-for-TV moments — the untold story of the most important congressional investigation in generations.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: The nine members of the Jan. 6 committee before its final public meeting on Dec. 19. Clockwise from top left: Representatives Pete Aguilar, Stephanie Murphy, Bennie Thompson, Elaine Luria, Zoe Lofgren, Adam Schiff, Liz Cheney, Adam Kinzinger and Jamie Raskin.
media.copyright: Philip Montgomery for The New York Times

results.title: An Iowa Sports Reporter Was Sent to Cover the Weather. He Did Not Like It.
results.abstract: After sporting events were canceled in Iowa, Mark Woodley was pressed into service covering the storm. “I didn’t realize that there was a 3:30 also in the morning until today,” he said.

media.caption: Mark Woodley, a sports anchor and reporter for KWWL in Iowa, reporting live, if grudgingly, from Waterloo very early on Friday morning.

results.adx_keywords: Historic Buildings and Sites;Architecture;Churches (Buildings);Restoration and Renovation;Guastavino Moreno, Rafael (1842-1908);Cathedral Church of St John the Divine (Manhattan, NY);Ennead Architects
results.title: Cathedral of St. John Finally Solves a 100-Year-Old Problem
results.abstract: The cathedral’s dome, a tour de force of tile, was supposed to be temporary. Instead, it’s lasted more than a century. Now, after a $17 million rehab, it could last a couple hundred more.
org_facet: Cathedral Church of St John the Divine (Manhattan, NY)

media.caption: The Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine has a massive dome built of terra-cotta tile by the Guastavino Fireproof Construction Company. The dome deteriorated over the years, but now, after a three-year project, the tilework has been restored and a new copper roof added.
media.copyright: Victor Llorente for The New York Times

results.byline: By Charles Homans, Jazmine Ulloa and Blake Hounshell
results.title: How the Worst Fears for Democracy Were Averted in 2022
results.abstract: A precariously narrow but consequential slice of the electorate broke with its own voting history to reject openly extremist Republican candidates — at least partly out of concern for the health of the political system.

media.caption: Joe Mohler, a local Republican committeeman in Pennsylvania, went against his own voting history in order to reject openly extremist Republican candidates.

results.title: The One About When Groucho Marx and Dick Cavett Became Great Friends
results.abstract: The beloved talk-show host, now 86, spoke about a new PBS documentary that tells the story of the friendship that changed his life.

media.caption: “I think I was in a state of exalting disbelief and joy that I had Groucho sitting there and being Groucho Marx,” Dick Cavett said of his friend, who appeared on his show seven times.
